pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:5.1: 46. The training rule on stuffing the cheeks
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate stuffing their cheeks. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:7.2: “‘I will not eat stuffing the cheeks,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:8.1: One should not eat stuffing the cheeks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect eats stuffing one or both cheeks, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:9.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:10.1: The sixth training rule is finished.
